title: Slow Cooker Teriyaki Meatballs
directions: In a medium saucepan add the water and the corn starch and whisk to combine.
Add the sugar, honey, soy sauce, garlic powder, and sesame oil to the pan and stir to combine.
Heat the pan over medium-high heat, stirring often, until the mixture comes to a boil.
Boil for 2 minutes until the mixture thickens.
Place the meatballs in the slow cooker and pour the sauce over the top.
Cook according to package directions (3 to 3Â½ hours on high for half a bag).
Stir gently halfway through cooking and once again before serving.

When you are ready to serve you can dish the meatballs onto a serving dish, ladle some of the sauce in the bottom of the slow cooker over the top and sprinkle with sesame seeds and chopped green onion OR you can just serve them right out of the slow cooker as they are.
